programme.title: UEFA Champions League Classics
programme.desc: The 2001/02 UEFA Champions League final saw a star-studded Real Madrid face Bayer Leverkusen in Glasgow. The match featured arguably the greatest goal in the competition's history.

programme.title: Premier League: The Big Interview
programme.desc: Claude Makelele looks back on a glittering 20-year career, during which he redefined the role of the defensive midfielder and gained legendary status at Stamford Bridge.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: Edwin van der Sar has faced down pressure on the biggest stages in world football, but his toughest battle came after retirement. In 2023, the legendary goalkeeper suffered a life-threatening brain haemorrhage. In this episode Edwin opens up on his recovery and looks back on his career at the top that redefined goalkeeping. From Champions League glory with Ajax and Manchester United to his command

programme.desc: Ultimate Pool action from Group 14 of the Pairs Cup, featuring Rob Wharne and Jimmy Croxton, Jaden Billingham and Sean Ashe, and Richard Gifford and Kyron Hewitt.

programme.desc: Men's Cycling Pro Series action from the 2025 Giro della Toscana in Tuscany, Italy. This year's edition will celebrate the memory of the legendary Alfredo Martini.

programme.title: Premier League Stories
programme.desc: Edwin van der Sar has faced down pressure on the biggest stages in world football, but his toughest battle came after retirement. In 2023, the legendary goalkeeper suffered a life-threatening brain haemorrhage. In this episode Edwin opens up on his recovery and looks back on his career at the top that redefined goalkeeping. From Champions League glory with Ajax and Manchester United to his command

programme.title: Live: Women's Australian Rules
programme.desc: Action from the AFLW as Carlton take on Gold Coast Suns at IKON Park. The Blues won 39-38 when these sides went head-to-head last year.

programme.desc: Action from the AFLW as GWS Giants meet Western Bulldogs at Corroboree Group Oval Manuka. The Giants are still searching for their first win of the season.

programme.title: Fishing: On the Bank
programme.desc: Rob and Andy are at the Viaduct Fishery in Somerset to take part in the Pound Challenge. Who will claim bragging rights in this species hunt?

programme.title: NWSL
programme.desc: Action from the National Women's Soccer League as Racing Louisville FC face Portland Thorns at Lynn Family Stadium. The Thorns are looking to avoid a third defeat in a row.

programme.title: NWSL
programme.desc: Action from the National Women's Soccer League as NJ/NY Gotham FC take on Angel City FC at Sports Illustrated Stadium. Angel are seeking their third win on the trot.

programme.title: Formula E Flashback
programme.desc: We revisit the 2021 Berlin ePrix and the final race of Season 7. With 13 drivers still in contention to win the title, who would claim the crown in this thrilling race?

programme.title: Formula E Flashback
programme.desc: We look back at the first Formula E race, which took place at the Beijing Olympic Green Circuit in 2014. The race would end in dramatic fashion with a huge collision.

programme.title: Formula E Flashback
programme.desc: We revisit 2015 and the thrilling race at Battersea Park Street Circuit in London. Nelson Piquet Jr. had an opportunity to claim his first Formula E title.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as Northampton Saints face Gloucester Rugby at cinch Stadium. Saints secured a record-breaking 90-0 victory in this fixture last season.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from the Recreation Ground as Bath Rugby face an Exeter Chiefs side who are still searching for their first win of the 2024/25 Gallagher Premiership Rugby campaign.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Sale Sharks face high-flyers Leicester Tigers at Salford Community Stadium. Can the Tigers continue their fearsome league form?

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Gloucester Rugby take on Harlequins at Kingsholm Stadium. Can Gloucester make it three league wins in a row?

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Gallagher Premiership Rugby action as Leicester Tigers face Bristol Bears at Mattioli Woods Welford Road. The Bears completed a memorable comeback when these sides met in April.

programme.title: PREM Rugby
programme.desc: Action from Gallagher Premiership Rugby as Sale Sharks face Exeter Chiefs at Salford Community Stadium. Can the Chiefs end their seven-game losing run?

programme.title: SailGP: Racing on the Edge
programme.desc: Facing unprecedented penalty points and internal turmoil, the Germany SailGP Team fights to prove their worth on home waters.

programme.title: Live: SailGP
programme.desc: Day one of the 2025 Rockwool France Sail Grand Prix, which takes place in the idyllic setting of Saint-Tropez. Emirates GBR took the honours here last season.

programme.title: UEFA Champions League: Stories of the Finals
programme.desc: Look back at the 2014 UEFA Champions League final between Real Madrid and Atletico Madrid. Real left it late to take the game to extra-time before beating their rivals 4-1.

programme.title: CPL T20
programme.desc: Highlights from the Caribbean Premier League clash between Barbados Royals and St. Kitts & Nevis Patriots at Kensington Oval.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The East-leading Tiger-Cats (7-5) aim to grow their advantage when they host the Blue Bombers (6-6). Hamilton is 2-4 against Western Conference foes this season. Winnipeg has won seven of its last nine meetings with Hamilton, including two Grey Cups.

programme.title: CFL Football
programme.desc: The Redblacks visit the Lions. Ottawa earned a come-from-behind 34-33 victory in the first leg of the home-and-home Sept. 5. Redblacks quarterback Dustin Crum ran for two scores and threw the game-winning TD pass to Eugene Lewis in the final minute.

programme.title: Live: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of Saturday's biggest games, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit, Desmond Howard, Pat McAfee, and Nick Saban cover college football with pregame breakdowns, exclusive interviews, features and predictions.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 19 Crimson Tide (1-1) prepare for another test as they host the Badgers (2-0) in Week 3. Alabama got on the board with a 73-0 dismantling of Louisiana Monroe on Sept. 6. Bama rolled to a 42-10 verdict over Wisconsin on Sept. 14, 2024.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: A heavyweight bout in the SEC sees the No. 15 Volunteers (2-0) hosting the No. 6 Bulldogs (2-0). Georgia's 31-17 victory last season was its eighth in a row over Tennessee. Bulldogs tight end Oscar Delp had a pair of TD catches in the 2024 win.

programme.title: Live: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: Live: College Football
programme.desc: The Gators and No. 3 Tigers meet in Death Valley. In Week 2, LSU moved to 2-0 with a win over Louisiana Tech, while Florida suffered a shocking home loss to South Florida. The Gators snapped a five-game slide with a 27-16 win over the Tigers in 2024.

programme.title: Live: WNBA Basketball
programme.desc: The Sky host the Liberty to finish the regular season. New York had won five consecutive meetings prior to a 91-85 verdict for Chicago on Aug. 21. Sky center Kamilla Cardoso scored 22 points and matched a career high with 15 rebounds in that win.

programme.title: NFL Football
programme.desc: Micah Parsons and the Packers host the Commanders. Parsons' 10.5 sacks in eight games versus Washington are his most against one team. The clubs opened 2025 with divisional wins. The Commanders defeated the Giants while the Packers beat the Lions.

programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series Round of 16 comes to an end with the Bass Pro Shops Night Race. Denny Hamlin punched his ticket to the next round and leapfrogged teammate Chase Briscoe in the points standings with a win at the Enjoy Illinois 300 on Sept. 7.
